content:
2024 Editors,

The Basic User Manual is looking great. I think you can all be quite proud of this work. Right now I am setting up a local Dokuwiki server and downloading the Wiki so that hopefully we can create more a portable PDF and html manuals.

As noted in 2024 Status and Progress There are just a few places where some small improvements, clarifications and screenshots are missing.  I think it is just 4 places that I know of, these are:

  • Connect to GNSS    Need Raspberry Pi and MacOS Screenshots

  • Vector DisplayDONE Rick 5/27  Needs work See Safety Depth Setting

  • Use RoutesNeeds Work Rick,5/27, Mermike 5/29 split route, 3 minor  Needs integration of new material from route properties.

  • Use GPX FilesDONE? John  need Waypoint records.

If these could be fixed before I get the Dokuwiki Server running so we can actually complete the full PDF export (which times out on the OpenCPN server), then the Manual will be 100% complete as far as we know. If these can't be completed, that is probably not such a big issue.

It appears that we have made the June 8 deadline set weeks ago (I had my doubts even then!) . Great job you guys. It wouldn't have happened but for all your efforts, I think we all learned new things about OpenCPN, I know I learned from each of you. I hope you will stay involved and continue to refine improve and update what has become the best User Manual yet!  I hope you hear my applause to this great group of skilled editors!

Thanks, again. You have given the OpenCPN a wonderful gift.

Rick
